relation: Get in EOPS if you can!
Great teachers, for the most part. Definitely join programs available to you.
The theater shows are pretty fun, and there are various events and games to attend as well if you are interested. If you are in clubs your options open up more.
Sadly there doesn't seem to be much good food to eat on campus, not many options in the cafeteria and can be pricey imo.
Homework/Study load can get a little heavy even without having a job (Though I am in a heavy science/math major so I'm sure that effects my load.)
Apply to the EOPS program, or see if you qualify for CARE, EFY, and ACE programs, they are tremendously helpful!

Golden West, so far, has been a great school. There are a lot of programs that can cover most, if not all, enrollment, book, and material fees. Involvement in the clubs and programs help to provide an excellent support system for their students.
pageTitle: Golden West College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {115347=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 47754=I like Golden West, i've been attending since 2005 and have had the best experiences with my teachers and student body alike. I've found the teachers are very helpful. The campus is small and intimate so you don't get overwhelmed with students everywhere all the time.}
